title: Grade 12 - Business Leadership: Management Fundamentals BOH4M (2006)
subject: Business Studies

document.title: Grade 12 - Business Leadership: Management Fundamentals BOH4M (2006)

EB377EA11F86449D9F740C04833F12E3.description: compare major performance-appraisal methods and techniques (e.g., comparisons, behaviourally anchored rating scale, graphic-rating scale, 360ï¿½ feedback).

E20D0501F4A7486F86A7B40E98E3F66C.description: explain the nature and importance of performance appraisal within an organization;

732E521DF10B4C93ACA968018BBD6A74.description: describe, drawing on information from a variety of sources, including the Internet, current management opportunities and the education and training they require;

E2EA905C3C424A5D8596E9DAA81BC1D4.description: explain the strategies and concepts involved in developing and retaining a quality workforce (e.g., career development, diversity policies, labour-management relations, orientation, training);

28B93F6F0C624729B3C703A302AD1990.description: analyse the relationship between an organization's objectives and the humanresource process (e.g., planning, recruitment, selection);

4AD6FC0BE5144B5FA56FFE9AC0075960.description: identify and describe the impact and importance of legal considerations in the human-resource process (e.g., with regard to wages, employment equity, health and safety, employee rights, bargaining agreements);

816E075972A84D6C94DF844A1126A756.description: Human Resource:  evaluate the role of human resources within an organization

67A5300CB387452FB50895F20309137A.description: compare the strengths and weaknesses of various work settings and arrangements for individuals and groups (e.g., job sharing, self-managed teams, work schedules, offsite work, contract work).

1234271CC8FF411198D02463BDE1357B.description: compare alternative job-design approaches (e.g., rotation, simplification, enrichment, enlargement);

C199D13FDDA641F79F6900CC1853BC3E.description: assess the relationship between the individual and an organization, considering issues such as the meaning of work, the psychological contract, the quality of work life, and job satisfaction;

89F41E2FAF13448C96E6E69AA6FAAE2F.description: The Changing Nature of Work: assess the ways in which organizational structures have changed to adapt to the changing nature of work;

961801B7927C4694B46C1EE177EE7497.description: explain how organizational design (e.g., communication channels, team structures, alternative work schedules) can support a positive corporate culture.

D85665000F2D4D38A714AA2E345BA79B.description: explain the role of the manager in dealing with trends in organizational design structures (e.g., shorter chain of command, decentralization, increased empowerment, move towards more organic structures);

B970E1E29B274E438D850D5262D4DE04.description: assess current organizational structures (e.g., team, network, boundaryless) with respect to the ways in which they increase productivity and competitive advantage;

67D3C67827A8438091CAD15A8DE7222F.description: assess the four traditional organizational structures (functional, divisional, hybrid, matrix);

3C23B317CC724CB9B0B01490E51AC61E.description: Organizational Structures: demonstrate an understanding of the various organizational structures used to manage the workforce effectively;

0F154CFC08FE45358D40BA8DEE4CA01C.description: explain the three types of control systems used by organizations (feedforward, concurrent, feedback).

35C44041FEDD4D5FBDEA82AB5858BDA3.description: describe the impact of internal control measures (e.g., self-discipline, goal setting) and external control measures (e.g., compensation systems, progressive discipline) on an organization;

3807B52EE3524CA0964A7128B17839C1.description: describe progressive discipline and its impact on the individual within an organization;

B3045836205C427B9DF715C0614BF5E1.description: describe the steps in the control process and how they relate to the managerial process of leading, planning, and organizing;

0CA0BB4155024D72B473C0972F4A8537.description: Controlling: assess the importance of control in management.

9AD92467519149F085577D21A1CA7F63.description: analyse major challenges (e.g., new technologies, the influence of the Internet, globalization) and legal considerations (e.g., workplace safety standards, access for people with disabilities, pay equity) facing today's organizations.

FE5D3594F5A6412E972ED19984A2B474.description: evaluate different strategies used by managers to bring about acceptance of planned change (e.g., education, shared power, negotiation);

7B8510C94EB6449092B0BA8DF00701C0.description: analyse the elements that bring about change in an organization (e.g., developments in information technology, implementation of a growth plan, evolution of the organizational culture);

A69BC71F332F429195ACF921101BA6F0.description: The Management of Change: analyse how companies respond to internal and external pressures for change;

AB6E312D025E4F798F1D77F4D74F37B1.description: analyse the two levels of corporate culture (core and observable) and describe the relationship between corporate culture and strategic planning.

DFC19F952EDC46E48AD461722E5BAA35.description: analyse organizational strategic plans, using a variety of management tools (e.g., strengths, weaknesses, opportunties, threats analysis [SWOT analysis]; political, environmental, social, technological analysis; Porter's five forces competitive model);

80E77395A66E4B3EA0AEE5B0789ECF05.description: describe the types of strategic plans (e.g., growth, retrenchment, e-business) used by specific organizations;

CB86B5865C664B6FA1764F46805C79D3.description: explain the importance of the strategic planning process and describe the levels of strategic planning (corporate, business, functional) in an organization;

DC8E691FE2774516BEC15927AC129E26.description: Strategic Planning: analyse the relationship between strategic planning and the success of an organization;

C9698EFFA96644C18AFC9D9C163E3C68.description: demonstrate the ability to use timemanagement techniques.

CE980E325E5F4782BAA8255ACE4C55DD.description: explain the use of effective short-term planning tools and strategies (e.g., policies, operational plans, planning approaches) and long-term planning tools (e.g., budgets, strategic plans, simulations, forecasts);

2CC5C35D38CD4D5E89F57FD3EBDB7A4D.description: describe tools and strategies used in the planning process (e.g., participatory planning, benchmarking, scenario planning);

2C45DA49B7084FBC961285EDE6194852.description: Planning Tools and Techniques: demonstrate an understanding of appropriate planning tools and techniques in a variety of situations;

3A72D4C07AB2475FA5EA2B605EAA8973.description: analyse the importance of individual and group creativity in planning.

A60E797C19764D7E9A2268D0902CC2C7.description: apply different problem-solving strategies to a variety of management planning challenges;

131A97E66F2A493D954A67130942EF0B.description: describe the planning process and its benefits to the organization (e.g., flexibility, coordination, time management);

E584F8DD8B2B489B92B984D2A4EA4F8C.description: The Importance of Planning: analyse the importance of planning to the success of an organization;

9FC5BF4D059D41A39344807DE9A44F82.description: explain the relationship between motivation, rewards, and job performance.

6312365DC03B4ACEA45F3AE472347B40.description: analyse the various motivational strategies used by particular organizations;

B92EBE1B4AD54902A695B8CA913067B2.description: explain how various theories of motivation (e.g., the theories of Maslow, Herzberg, Alderfer, McClelland; goal-setting theory) contribute to an understanding of individual needs, productivity, and performance;

2771C74F2C22429FB35EAABA37E96185.description: Motivation: compare theories of how to motivate individuals and teams in a productive work environment

CC6D1258D00B42829C6BD491461D4E27.description: evaluate conflict-management styles (e.g., collaboration, avoidance, accommodation, compromise) and their impact on a situation

200E256BAAAB49D793EE6F73C945BD94.description: identify stress-reduction techniques used in organizations (e.g., wellness programs, meditation, time-management training, flex-time);

5DED495E6349431FA7CFFD1CC529CE14.description: describe the factors that contribute to stress and conflict in the workplace (e.g., working conditions, difficult bosses or co-workers, restructuring);

92295B18876A42EAB12B1DB469363E29.description: evaluate the impact of personal and workrelated stress on performance;

8AB84F2CB3A24C76930023D2D772F4A8.description: Stress and Conflict Management:  evaluate the strategies used by individuals and organizations to manage stress and conflict;

8EFD9C22C5E54DC8B43CC9346790C0BA.description: analyse how personal perception can influence the interpretation of information and thereby affect the decisions an individual makes.

2D3715D349C74E34AD895B11BC52296E.description: describe the techniques used to improve communication skills (e.g., active listening, constructive feedback, use of technological tools);

3FB69630B7DA45E8989F2C5CC0AA4B9B.description: explain the barriers and obstacles to effective communication (e.g., cultural differences, differences in perception, inappropriate communication channels, misunderstanding of semantics);

315070D42DE4443A8881A8045583A81F.description: The Communication Process in the Workplace: demonstrate an understanding of the communication process within the workplace;

9A7ABA36DC09417AB763997BFAA90E4C.description: compare different leadership styles (e.g., democratic, autocratic, laissez-faire, collaborative) and describe how these styles are exemplified by a variety of business leaders (e.g., men and women from diverse ethnocultural groups, including Aboriginal peoples).

BEB4A634D112452FBB8F80020896516C.description: compare a variety of contemporary leadership theories (e.g., Leadership Grid, contingency, transactional, transformational, and servant theories);

19AC92D269EB451795E7B47C239EF1BF.description: analyse the characteristics of effective leaders (e.g., integrity, drive, vision, commitment to equity and diversity in the workplace);

00ED0205BCCC46E3A656221F7D327BB6.description: Leadership Techniques: demonstrate an understanding of proper leadership techniques in a variety of situations

0D03B3564ADC464D84D73EA1F8173767.description: apply business teamwork skills to carry out projects and solve problems.

A106AB9D2AC342598751EFDE1D596305.description: analyse the factors that contribute to the success or failure of a team (e.g., shared norms, cohesiveness, cultural expectations, social loafing);

6FE161F9B1584DBF93114749F16449B2.description: explain the nature and types of groups within an organization (e.g., formal/ informal, committees/departments, electronic work groups);

FFAE82F6108D4714B240C4F91EE95D69.description: analyse the stages of group development (forming, storming, norming, performing, and adjourning) and the roles individuals assume within a group structure;

D0CF5212D0A3443FB873F8ED6EAA703F.description: Group Dynamics:  demonstrate an understanding of group dynamics;

29E8FD3724564B549369607555A5DA60.description: evaluate the use of personality traits assessment instruments in the workplace (e.g., Myers-Briggs,True Colors, Emotional Intelligence)

1A934E51159D41AA929154EDDA4053F6.description: explain the relationship between a person's attitude (e.g., commitment to job, personal biases ) and her or his behaviour in the workplace (e.g., quality of performance, absenteeism; engaging in practices that reflect racist, sexist, or homophobic attitudes);

F0A30B11A55F469FB581A95C2D00292C.description: explain the relationship between job satisfaction and an individual's personality, attitudes, and perceptions;

C30DCFCCECCE4B0E9D627605413C8ACB.description: analyse the elements that shape human personality (e.g., cultural, social, and family influences) and their impact on human behaviour;

46F4598E64394CDC92A8F424775923D6.description: Human Behaviour:  apply an understanding of human behaviour to explain how individuals and groups function in the workplace;

4ED88557C28A4D79BAD772A7A8D838AE.description: explain the nature of corporate ethical and social responsibility and analyse, on the basis of research, including stakeholder analysis, a particular company's commitment to it (e.g., in relation to non-discriminatory hiring, promotion, and retention practices; implementing the Persons with Disabilities Act and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act; environmental issues; customer/supplier relationships).

EC8E5F264BC540168220A35AC07A3676.description: evaluate the impact of major ethical issues (e.g., bribery, harassment, polluting the environment, theft in the workplace, Aboriginal land claims versus interests of resource companies ) and dilemmas (e.g., for the individual, the workplace, and the local and global community) on management strategies and decision making;

F20E66572C854586AD7B081550BACBC6.description: Issues of Ethics and Social Responsibility: evaluate the impact of issues related to ethics and social responsibility on the management of organizations

D619F121E15349ABB2AE044AA4A4BB9F.description: demonstrate effective use of business communication documents (e.g., business reports, correspondence).

0B2E57D642674C398BB4B8B502443932.description: use proper business vocabulary in oral and written communication;

641C1AB0EFE843959CE9916845593AD0.description: demonstrate an understanding of management concepts and theories discussed in relation to current business issues in a variety of sources (e.g., newspapers, magazines, documentaries, websites);

C1CD9ED5E9C1491785A3995ABFCDDD08.description: demonstrate appropriate techniques for making group and individual presentations (e.g., use a variety of appropriate visual aids, make eye contact where appropriate, speak clearly);

02F6C4B1B1E84C19BF36DEC78ECCD204.description: demonstrate the effective use of information and communication technology (e.g., word processing software, e-mail, electronic research tools) for a variety of management purposes;

04DCA60E9CFF475CA63CCDF0211E0D6B.description: Business Communication: demonstrate the use of appropriate communication techniques related to business management;

6171BB6C4AB24EEA9F76F993CB543DA1.description: evaluate major management theories and practices (e.g., classical, behavioural, quantitative approach, systems theories; total quality management).

80759F21CEEC408E9E7CE1BCDCC12466.description: evaluate the different levels of management with respect to roles, responsibilities, activities, skills, and competencies;

5450D53EA712408D8CE97CC37E249119.description: identify the characteristics of an organization (e.g., purpose, division of labour, hierarchy of authority);

E26EBCC7D1B34F4C855C9AE03B648873.description: Management Fundamentals:  assess the role of management within an organization;
